function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Large sample volumes and effective concentration of virus particles may lower method detection limits.","Impact":"Increased risk of undetected virus presence in wastewater.","Mitigation":"Implementing advanced concentration techniques and technologies.","Technologies":"Advanced filtration and concentration methods.","People":"Public health authorities, water treatment facilities.","Owner":"Research institutions, technology developers."},{"Description":"Desire to keep required sample sizes low for economic shipping.","Impact":"Risk of missing virus detection due to small sample sizes.","Mitigation":"Optimizing sampling techniques and transportation methods.","Technologies":"Portable sensor technologies for on-site testing.","People":"Laboratory technicians, logistics personnel.","Owner":"Transportation companies, research and development teams."},{"Description":"Difficulty in obtaining data on the infectivity of sewage-borne SARS-CoV-2.","Impact":"Limited understanding of the transmission risk from sewage.","Mitigation":"Establishing safe research protocols and procedures for infectious agent analysis.","Technologies":"Biological safety level certification and pathogen detection technologies.","People":"Researchers, laboratory personnel.","Owner":"Regulatory authorities, research institutions."},{"Description":"Need for a study on the decay and detectability of SARS-CoV-2 as a function of temperature.","Impact":"Lack of crucial information on virus survival and persistence in different conditions.","Mitigation":"Conducting temperature-based survival studies and data analysis.","Technologies":"Temperature-controlled incubation chambers, data analysis software.","People":"Public health researchers, environmental scientists.","Owner":"Research institutions, government research agencies."}]}
